definition: to bicker/to argue for the sake of arguing/to carry on poles (together with sb else)/to carry a coffin on poles
to lift/to raise/(of two or more persons) to carry
thick pole/bar/rod/thick line/to mark with a thick line/to sharpen (knife)/(old) coffin-bearing pole

sentences.english: I did not know whether to resent this language or pursue my explanation;
sentences.chinese: 我不知道是跟他抬杠好，还是继续解释好。

sentences.english: In fact, I had to simply shirk argument and do the diplomatic instead.
sentences.chinese: 事实上，我还就得避免抬杠，而用点儿。

sentences.english: The young man takes delight in contradicting others.
sentences.chinese: 这年青人爱和别人抬杠。
“我们做的还不够过么”别的队员接着抬杠。

sentences.english: They inserted the poles into the rings so they would be on the sides of the altar for carrying it.
sentences.chinese: 把杠穿在坛两旁的环子内，用以抬杠。

sentences.english: You always like wrangling with others.
sentences.chinese: 你总是喜欢和比人抬杠。

definition: to express a different view/to take a different position
(coll.) to wag one's tongue/to indulge in idle gossip and silly jokes/to chatter endlessly/to speak glibly
erhua variant of 較勁|较劲[jiao4 jin4]
to joke/to laugh insincerely/to make merry/to talk irrelevantly
to show off with clever talk/big-headed/a smart-ass
to talk glibly/to talk big/to be all talk
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
